captions.text:
Saddle up and put on your mx googles!
Cause it's time for the Red Bull Romaniacs.

It's dirty it's hard and it makes grown man
cry.

5 days of dirt, pain, exhaustion and sweat.
Get ready and start your engine, it's the
Red Bull Romaniacs
When I'm not racing, I'm either fixing a truck

or driving a truck. That's what I do. That's
what Taddy does, that's what Dougie does but

you know that's it. I work for living they
don't.

What I'm doing when I'm not riding a bike.
You got me stumped there.

I spend most of the time doing rider coaching.
So I teach people, take people out, teach

some final points of enduro riding and some
guys hard enduro riding.

I work a lot. I'm rebuilding my house. I spend
a lot of time with my children. Especially

with my son, who is a trial rider.
I work in a family business we own a manufacturing

business in South Africa. My parents allow
me to train and ride when I need to. So I

can sneak away whenever I need to get some
training and some riding.
That's what this is about. The help.

Well, I'm supported by my wife and my brother,
they are here, they are my pit crew and my

help.
I've got a fantastic personal life. I have

a really supportive fiance, Lisa. We are
actually getting married this year on the

7th of August.
I've got two kids, twins. 5 year olds. Spend

time with them. That's a good way to switch
off and have a little bit of fun.

Unfortunately the family and Monico couldn't
make it out this year. It's a big expensive

to get out from here from New Zealand. Maybe
next year they will come out.

The bike ran absolutely perfect today. KTM
was absolutely and 100 percent perfect. All the

little problems we had were solved. Fixed
it and just pulled it all day.

The first person I'm calling will be my wife
Monica, because she will be right awake sitting

on the bed at home. It's 2 o'clock in the
morning waiting for me to call.

Yeah, just happy to finish really. I'm quite
tired today and made a lot mistakes but I'm

glad to be at the finish point. I went from
the unluckiest guy to the luckiest.

By far it's 4 days of the hardest thing I've
ever done and I don't think I will be riding

my bike for 3 weeks so when I get back home.
It was good and I will definitely come back

next year.
After the 3 fucking days it was good today

and yeah.
I've got to come back next year. I will go

for the win next year. Yeah definitely.
I can't let someone else take my number one place.
